TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WsFederationConfiguration extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains all of the configuration settings needed by the WS-Federation Authentication Module ().

remarks.format: ## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration> class that is set on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property contains the settings that are used to initialize the properties of the WS-Federation Authentication Module (WSFAM) and control its behavior. These settings are typically loaded from the `<wsFederation>` element in the configuration file.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement federationElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The element from which to initialize the new instance.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties of the new instance are initialized according to the settings of the specified `<wsFederation>` element.
Some validation is performed on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement> object specified by `federationElement`. Both the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Issuer%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Realm%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property must specify non-null, non-empty values. If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.RequireHttps%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Issuer%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property must specify a URI that has an HTTPS scheme. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Freshness%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property cannot be negative. If any of these conditions are not met, an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string issuer, string realm) cil managed
Public Sub New (issuer As String, realm As String)

Docs.param: A string that contains the URI of the issuer to be used by the WS-Federation Authentication Module (WSFAM).
A string that contains the URI of the requesting realm to be used by the WSFAM.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified issuer and realm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Issuer%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Realm%2A> properties are initialized according to the `issuer` and `realm` parameters. All other properties are initialized to their default values.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AuthenticationType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AuthenticationType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the wauth parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
Docs.value: A URI that specifies the authentication type. The default is an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary that contains any extra attributes specified in the element in the configuration file.
Docs.value: The dictionary that contains the extra attributes.

Docs.summary: A constant that contains the default value for the property; zero.
A constant that sets the default property of the XML dictionary reader quotas object referenced by the property.
A constant that sets the default property of the XML dictionary reader quotas object referenced by the property.
A constant that contains the default value for the property; , passive redirects are enabled.
A constant that contains the default value for the property; , cookies are not enabled.
A constant that contains the default value for the property; , HTTPS is required on redirects.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a URI that identifies the intended issuer of the security token.
Docs.value: The URI that identifies the security token service (STS). Cannot be .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the module is enabled to initiate WS-Federation protocol redirects.
Docs.value: to enable redirects; otherwise, . The default is , redirects are enabled.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a persistent session cookie is issued on successful authentication.
Docs.value: to issue a persistent session cookie; otherwise, . The default is , cookies are not enabled.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the wreply parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
Docs.value: A URL that identifies the address at which the relying party (RP) application would like to receive replies from the Security Token Service (STS). The default is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RequireHttps { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RequireHttps : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether communication with the security token service (STS) must use HTTPS protocol.
Docs.value: if communication with the STS must be secured using HTTPS; otherwise, . The default is , HTTPS is required.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Resource { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Resource : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the wres parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
Docs.value: A URI that identifies the resource being accessed, the relying party (RP), to the to the security token service (STS). The default is an empty string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The wtrealm parameter, which is set by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Realm%2A> property, should be used instead of this parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignInQueryString { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignInQueryString : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a query string that contains any additional parameters to be sent in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
Docs.value: A URL fragment that contains the additional message parameters in the following format: "?param1=value1&param2=value2&paramN=valueN". The default is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignOutQueryString { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignOutQueryString : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a query string that contains any additional parameters to be sent in WS-Federation sign-out requests ("wsignout1.0") during passive sign-out.
Docs.value: A URL fragment that contains the additional message parameters in the following format: "?param1=value1&param2=value2&paramN=valueN". The default is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignOutReply { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignOutReply : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the wreply parameter to use during WS-Federation sign-out requests ("wsignout1.0").
Docs.value: The URL to which the client should be redirected by the security token service (STS) during passive sign-out through the WS-Federation protocol. The default is an empty string.
